reviewText: I DID NOT THINK I WOULD LIKE THIS PLAY BECAUSE MADEA WAS NOT IN IT, (IT'S NOT QUITE AS FUNNY WITHOUT MADEA), BUT IT IS GOOD. I CAN REALLY RELATE TO THIS PLAY AS A MARRIED WOMAN. I HAVE BEEN THROUGH SOME OF THOSE THINGS THAT HAPPENED IN THAT PLAY. IT'S VERY SPIRITUAL AND IT LETS YOU KNOW THAT IF YOU BELIEVE IN GOD, HE WILL BRING YOU THROUGH! I LOVED DONNA STEWART IN THIS PLAY TOO, SHE WAS A REAL PERSON WHO TOLD IT LIKE IT WAS. I CAN RELATE TO HER THE MOST. TYLER PERRY DID GOOD.
Title: Tyler Perry's Why Did I Get Married?: The Play

reviewText: I must say that this is my favorite play without Madea. This play has so many messages in it.. If you are thinking about getting married or already married you will be pleased with this play...Tyler Perry does it again. Do yourself a favor and buy this play...

reviewText: Everything Tyler Perry puts out is good to me. This is a must see DVD if you want a good laugh.Madea isn't in all the plays, but they are just as good because they are written by Tyler Perry.Get this DVD
Title: Tyler Perry's Why Did I Get Married?: The Play

reviewText: Tyler Perry has done it again, I wasn't sure I would like the play as much without any of the original characters from the Madea plays, but I was certainly pleasantly surprised.  This was a true portrayal of the ups and downs of marriage.  It spoke to the hard work a good marriage takes.  It was a story of forgiveness, redemption, reconciliation, recognizing your self worth and starting over.  Cheryl "Pepsi" Riley was pheonomenal and her song about choosing a man without God's guidance being more than a sin was so accurate it touched my heart.  I can't wait to tell others in my church about this play, married and those waiting to be married will certainly benefit from the message of this play.
Title: Tyler Perry's Why Did I Get Married?: The Play

reviewText: I love Tyler Perry's work, and this play is one of his best. It explores the challenges and blessings of married life, and I would recommend it for anyone who is considering marriage. Whether you've been married for many years or are just newly married, watch this one with your beloved. You'll see parts of yourself and your spouse in this video, and you'll laugh, cry and give thanks along with the main characters. Caution - it will make you dislike some men, but know that it all works out in the end.
summary: One of Tyler Perry's best - highly recommended!
Title: Tyler Perry's Why Did I Get Married?: The Play

reviewText: I enjoyed this DVD.  I thought Kelly Price would be in the play, but it turns out that Cheryl Pepsi Riley was the star.  She did an excellent job and was in good voice.The storyline was behind every good man is a good woman.  It also let you know that marriage is hard work.  It is not just a fine man/woman.  When the body goes and the love is old, we have to remember the wedding vows.The family/friends are all coming together for a weekend retreat at the patriachs house for a weekend of rest and relaxation.  The father offers words wisdom that his wife used to offer before she died.One couple has worked on their marriage and made it worked; but when the wife in the other couple discovers that her husband is cheating with her best friend, she goes balistic and shoots up the place.  After the divorce, she gives him everything in the divorce settlement and begins to work on herself.  He marries the friend and she marries someone no one thinks will ever settle down because he has always been in love with her.  Her husband discovers that the grass is not always greener on the other side and wants her back.  His busines is falling off and she tells him that she is the one that kept him afloat.  He begins to think back and would do anything to get his wife back and give his gold digging new wife back.
Title: Tyler Perry's Why Did I Get Married?: The Play

reviewText: It was good.  I saw the movie before the play and I liked the movie better.  It's still good enough.

reviewText: A great Tyler Perry play - one of the best plays, in my opinion.  All of the characters are high spirited and interact very well.  The story line is super predictable, but it is not dull - you root for the underdogs, the true friends, and those who just do what they believe is right.  There is a heavy Christian theme, but I am not a Christian and I enjoy the play very much.  Thanks to Amazon for making it available for a pretty reasonable price.
Title: Tyler Perry's Why Did I Get Married?: The Play

reviewText: This play is slightly different from Mr. Perry's other plays, mainly because Madea is not in it. The great thing is that the play was still enjoyable! The relationship of Tony Grant, Cheryl Pepsii Riley and Demetria Dyan McKinney made for a very interesting, very surprising plot! I enjoyed every minute of it!P.S. If you're trying to decide whether to watch this movie based on the preview clip shown above, that clip is from the opening of the play. It does no justice to how wonderful the play actually is! Trust me, you'll enjoy it!
summary: Entertainment At It's Best Even Without Madea

Title: Tyler Perry's Why Did I Get Married?: The Play

reviewText: I loved it.  I love anything Tyler Perry does, though, so there's no real suprise there.  This play was written extremely well and the characters were well developed.The play was about a couple's retreat and friends getting together and enjoying their spouses.  My favorite character was Diana, because I promise I've done some of the things she talks about having done to a cheating man :o) and because she's such an honest character.  I didn't really like Sheila's character when she was first introduced to us, because in my opinion after 3 kids a woman becomes strong enough to stand up for herself.  But, once she had her spiritual and physical transformation and make over, I was really proud of her.Watching this movie will make you think about things that you take for granted and make you evaluate forgiveness and the true power of love.  I would recommend this to anyone in a committed, long term relationship.
Title: Tyler Perry's Why Did I Get Married?: The Play

reviewText: Another one of my faves by Tyler Perry!!!  Please add it to your Tyler Perrry Collection.  You will not be disappointed.

Title: Tyler Perry's Why Did I Get Married?: The Play

reviewText: I enjoy Tyler Perry but this was my favorite play!  Perry is a writer after my own heart.  He manages to show how good sexuality is in marriage, which is hard to find in the Christian movies or books I'm used to reading.  His work is refreshing and entertaining.  In this particular play, he does an excellent job in combining humor into serious subject matter.  It's focus is on an unfaithful spouse who ends up leaving his wife for a thin and "prettier" woman (who happens to be a friend of the wife's).  The husband's treatment of his wife is a powerful description of verbal abuse, and I felt horrible for the wife, which was the point.The second half of the play covered the next year at the cabin, and I had hoped the now ex-wife would be happier and the way Perry dragged that part out had me on the edge of my seat because I feared that she didn't end up with the man I hoped she would.  I don't want to ruin it but it is the best scene in the play and I found myself cheering when I discovered who her new love was.  By the audience's cheers, I wasn't alone in my joy.  This play is worth watching at least once.  And the songs are great too!Tyler Perry's Why Did I Get Married? (Full Screen Edition)
Title: Tyler Perry's Why Did I Get Married?: The Play

reviewText: Summary:  This movie is about three women: one woman who will look at anything with a bank card who refers to himself as a roughneck, a second woman who stands by her man and is willing to do almost anything to keep him regardless of how much he belittles her, and a third woman who (apparently) doesn't take any stuff and went through trials and tribulations with her husband but got through it on a positive light.  The third woman is more or less the (unasked for) advisee to the other two: one as an enemy and one as a friend.  One terrible husband, one patient, wiser husband, and one guy who's just trying to find love all mix in to make the play more interesting.  The single guy is EXTREMELY cute, I might add!Pros: Every Tyler Perry movie does not need Madea or the dirty old man he plays to be funny, and I love the way the people he chooses to work with can bring some good comedy, good singing voices, and great acting in place of it.  I like how Tyler takes controversial topics as darts and throws them right at the board, so everyone can understand what he's aiming to prove.  Topics such as weight gain in marriage, infidelity, betrayal, golddiggers, fatherhood, religion, and love all help this play relate to anyone. Even for those who aren't married, there's something to be said about being single (and vice versa).  I found the weight gain issue to be one of the most honest and relevant topics in this book, not only because women do tend to gain weight over the years, but because many men do not understand the issues that women go through to get it off.  I've heard MANY smart remarks from guys (strangers, family, friends) throughout the years about heavyset women, and even had a couple thrown my way when I gained weight a couple years back. I'm a carb lover and a vegetarian so my weight goes up and down all the time, but it's immediately noticeable who's a jerk about it and who sympathizes when it goes up.  One thing I hope all in the audience and all those at home who watch it get from this is TEASING is NOT HELPING.  No one (man or woman) can lose weight with you picking on them; they will do it in their own time for their own benefit and someone nagging them to death about it is not going to work.  I found it interesting that one couple got through infidelity and made the relationship work. Although I don't necessarily agree with that, I come from a different generation that runs when the going gets tough, even though it's nice to see those that don't.  I was very impressed when the older man who played the father started singing. Man, he's got a voice!  He hit that high note and I looked around to see was it really him.  Wow!  I enjoyed the ending and all received there just dues.Cons:  I was a little confused why the feisty main female character was cast in the role she was in.  There was constant dialogue comparing her and the more vulnerable character in regards to weight, but both were heavyset.  The guys had a conversation and one said "Look at your wife, and look at mine" so I was wondering was the feistier character an understudy and the original actress didn't show up...or what?  I thought the plot would've been stronger if the husband would've said that he embraced his wife's weight INSTEAD of making it sound like she was a size 6.  It just seemed rather odd to me.  Not being disrespectful, but it was something that was obvious when watching the movie and I didn't get why the dialogue was put there in regards to that character.  I was genuinely shocked to find out that Pepsi, the more sensitive woman, was wearing a bodysuit. I thought that was her real weight.I loved the older guy, but him kicking his leg back for the fourth or fifth time got old.  He was wearing that joke into the ground.  I don't know who passes out wigs, but man, every Tyler Perry play has some woman with a bad wig on.  And as much as I like powerful singing voices, the feistier main character kept oversinging songs, but people who grew up in church have a terrible habit of doing that--after awhile it gets melodramatic and you just want them to finish the doggone song and get on with the play.
Title: Tyler Perry's Why Did I Get Married?: The Play

reviewText: I enjoyed this play mostly because it addresses the issues of marriage; these days folks take marriage for granted; I have been married once myself but even I know that it's sacred; I was truly feeling for Cheryl Pepsi Riley's character in the play a lot, but I was truly rooting for her in the end because she came out triumphantly.Good play.
Title: Tyler Perry's Why Did I Get Married?: The Play

reviewText: A play without Madea generally makes one pause. This was truly an awesome play with deep moving messages about marriage and relationships.  Tyler Perry knows what he's doing and this is just one more example of his ability to not only entertain, but to leave an imprint on your heart. A truly amazing piece of work!!
Title: Tyler Perry's Why Did I Get Married?: The Play

reviewText: There hasn't been a Tyler Perry movie, play or book that I haven't enjoyed.

reviewText: I Loved this play and the message that comes with it concerning marriage. Proverbs 18:22 says - A man that finds a wife finds a good thing and obtains favor from the Lord, the man is the one who suppose to be pursuing his soul mate not the other way around, so until we do things in decency and in order, the way the GOOD LORD has already out lined for us we will always go astray. This movie is a must see for singles wanting to be married one day, and for those who are already married, Tyler Perry did it again because he acknowledges GOD in all or his work.
